text: The student will construct programs to accomplish a task as a means of creative expression or scientific exploration using a block based or text based programming language, both independently and collaboratively,
subject: Computer Science
subs: combining control structures such as if-statements and loops including nested conditionals and loops;
using clearly named variables that represent different data types, including numeric and non-numeric data, and perform operations on their values; and
create procedures with parameters

text: The student will systematically test and refine programs using a range of test cases.
subject: Computer Science

text: The student will explain how effective communication between participants is required for successful collaboration when developing programs.
subject: Computer Science

text: The student will use flowcharts and/or pseudocode to address complex problems as algorithms.
subject: Computer Science

text: The student will, using the elements of computing devices such as primary memory, secondary storage, processor, input and output devices, and network connectivity, analyze the advantages and limitations of a given computing system.
subject: Computer Science

text: The student will evaluate physical and digital security measures used to protect electronic information.
subject: Computer Science

text: The student will identify impacts of hacking, ransomware, scams, fake vulnerability scans, and the ethical and legal concerns involved. Exclusion: Students do not need to implement solutions.
subject: Computer Science

text: The student will
subject: Computer Science
subs: explain the difference between a model and a simulation; and
create computational models to conduct simulations.

text: The student will describe tradeoffs between allowing information to be public and\ keeping information private.
subject: Computer Science

text: The student will evaluate online and print sources for appropriateness and credibility.
subject: Computer Science

text: The student will discuss the social impacts and ethical considerations associated with the field of cybersecurity.
subject: Computer Science

text: The student will explore careers related to the field of cybersecurity.
subject: Computer Science

text: The student will identify existing cybersecurity concerns associated with Internet use and Internet-based systems and potential options to address these issues.
subject: Computer Science

text: The student will compare and order real numbers.
subject: Mathematics

text: The student will describe the relationships between the subsets of the real number system.
subject: Mathematics

text: The student will
subject: Mathematics
subs: estimate and determine the two consecutive integers between which a square root lies; and
determine both the positive and negative square roots of a given perfect square.

text: The student will solve practical problems involving consumer applications.
subject: Mathematics

text: The student will use the relationships among pairs of angles that are vertical angles, adjacent angles, supplementary angles, and complementary angles to determine the measure of unknown angles.
subject: Mathematics

text: The student will
subject: Mathematics
subs: solve problems, including practical problems, involving volume and surface area ofcones and square-based pyramids; and
describe how changing one measured attribute of a rectangular prism affects the volume and surface area.

text: The student will
subject: Mathematics
subs: given a polygon, apply transformations, to include translations, reflections, and dilations, in the coordinate plane; and
identify practical applications of transformations.

text: The student will construct a three-dimensional model, given the top or bottom, side, and front views.
subject: Mathematics

text: The student will
subject: Mathematics
subs: verify the Pythagorean Theorem; and
apply the Pythagorean Theorem.

text: The student will solve area and perimeter problems, including practical problems, involving composite plane figures.
subject: Mathematics

text: The student will
subject: Mathematics
subs: compare and contrast the probability of independent and dependent events; and
determine probabilities for independent and dependent events.

text: The student will
subject: Mathematics
subs: represent numerical data in boxplots;
make observations and inferences about data represented in boxplots; and
compare and analyze two data sets using boxplots.

text: The student will
subject: Mathematics
subs: represent data in scatterplots;
make observations about data represented in scatterplots; and
use a drawing to estimate the line of best fit for data represented in a scatterplot.

text: The student will
subject: Mathematics
subs: evaluate an algebraic expression for given replacement values of the variables; and
simplify algebraic expressions in one variable.

text: The student will
subject: Mathematics
subs: determine whether a given relation is a function; and
determine the domain and range of a function.

text: The student will
subject: Mathematics
subs: recognize and describe the graph of a linear function with a slope that is positive, negative, or zero;
identify the slope and y-intercept of a linear function, given a table of values, a graph, or an equation in y = mx + b form;
determine the independent and dependent variable, given a practical situation modeled by a linear function;
graph a linear function given the equation in y = mx + b form; and
make connections between and among representations of a linear function using verbal descriptions, tables, equations, and graphs.

text: The student will solve multistep linear equations in one variable with the variable on one or both sides of the equation, including practical problems that require the solution of a multistep linear equation in one variable.
subject: Mathematics

text: The student will solve multistep linear inequalities in one variable with the variable on one or both sides of the inequality symbol, including practical problems, and graph the solution on a number line.
subject: Mathematics

text: The student will apply creative thinking to artmaking.
subject: Visual Art
subs: Communicate ideas, experiences, and narratives through the creation of original works of art, using self-selected media.
Synthesize prior knowledge and experience to develop a personal investigation by creating a series of works of art.

text: The student will apply steps of a creative process.
subject: Visual Art
subs: Plan for and reflect on the creative process, using a digital or traditional sketchbook/journal.
Develop and use a digital or traditional art portfolio as an idea-building resource to create works of art.

text: The student will analyze, interpret, and evaluate artwork.
subject: Visual Art
subs: Analyze how visual organization in works of art affects the communication of ideas.
Analyze the uses and impact of persuasive techniques (e.g., selection of images, design, type, media) in print and contemporary media.
Communicate how personal experiences influence critical interpretations and evaluations of works of art.
Formulate a working definition of art.
Analyze purposes, values, and meanings of works of art.
Critique personal work and the work of others to refine the quality of technical skill and communication of creative intent.

text: The student will describe and justify personal responses to visual qualities in works of art.
subject: Visual Art

text: The student will develop communication and collaboration skills for a community of artists.
subject: Visual Art
subs: Develop visual art topics for group discussions.
Recognize a variety of contributions to the class community.
Explain procedures for the safety and care of art materials and tools.

text: The student will explore and understand historical and cultural influences of art.
subject: Visual Art
subs: Describe how works of art are influenced by social, political, and economic factors.
Describe how society, politics, and economics may be influenced by art.
Compare and contrast works of art according to medium, time period, culture, style, and artist.
Identify contributions and significance of artists in historical and contemporay societies

text: The student will identify visual art resources in the community and the Commonwealth, including but not limited to community art centers, museums, and galleries.
subject: Visual Art

text: The student will explain and apply digital citizenship skills related to intellectual property in art research, creation, use of source materials, and sharing
subject: Visual Art

text: The student will investigate connections between visual arts skills and college, career, and workplace skills.
subject: Visual Art

text: The student will explore digital media for creating and engaging others through their artwork.
subject: Visual Art

text: The student will synthesize knowledge from other content areas to connect to visual arts knowledge and processes in order develop solutions to solve a real-world problem
subject: Visual Art

text: The student will use elements of art and principles of design to express meaning in works of art.
subject: Visual Art
subs: Color—contrasting relationships.
Value—shading.
Proportion—scale, ratio relationships.
Unity—harmony.
Variety.

text: The student will combine a variety of compositional techniques to create the illusion of space within the picture plane.
subject: Visual Art

text: The student will use observational and expressive drawing techniques to demonstrate multiple viewpoints (e.g., above, below, front, back).
subject: Visual Art

text: The student will refine personal works of art to improve quality of craftsmanship.
subject: Visual Art

text: The student will create three-dimensional works of art by combining a variety of techniques and processes.
subject: Visual Art

text: The student will explore abstraction of subject matter.
subject: Visual Art
